page.title: 01WHITEHAVEN AREA-GAZETTEER.
page.content: Whitehaven is a Georgian Town of historical interest.Most old buildings are being preserved.It is near the Lake District & has a dock & harbour which are used by fishing & leisure craft.Traditionally a mining area, there is now only one remaining pit, "Haig colliery,"which has been open for a very long time.The two main employers are Marchon Chemicals & B.N.F.L Windscales works.Unemployment is quite high in Whitehaven.Our shopping centre is growing,recently having new additions. We also have a Market every Saturday & Thursday.In town there's a museum with items of local interest.The countryside is mainly used for barley ,silage,hay or grazing sheep and cattle.Sporting activies range from Rugby League to Hound-trailing.Entertainments include a cinema,Civic Hall & nightclubs.
